ticket.title: RFC-0032 Phase 4: reviewer bridge (ClaimWorkV2(REVIEWER) + REVIEW_FINDING/REVIEW_VERDICT context entries + review receipt events)

in_scope: Ensure ClaimWorkV2 supports reviewer claim transition `ReadyForReview -> Review` with correct previous_transition_count
Define and publish WorkContextEntry kinds REVIEW_FINDING and REVIEW_VERDICT for reviewer loop artifacts
Integrate existing review receipt kernel events (e.g., review_receipt_recorded / review_blocked_recorded) with canonical storage in core ledger (bridge JSON -> protobuf later)
Ensure reviewer loop produces replayable, queryable artifacts in ledger+CAS (no GitHub-only truth requirement)

steps: Audit existing review receipt event emission paths and determine bridge strategy (accept both JSON and protobuf payloads during cutover)
Add CLI/daemon surfaces to publish REVIEW_FINDING/REVIEW_VERDICT entries via PublishWorkContextEntry
Update projections to index review context entries for doctor output
Add tests: reviewer claim transitions and publishing verdict entries is idempotent and stored

criteria: Reviewer loop artifacts (findings/verdict) are present in work context stream and replayable.
Review receipt events remain compatible during bridge window (topic derivation + projections accept both encodings where needed).

enforcement_requirements: Any new requirement, code path, or test added under this ticket must map to one or more required_invariants.
Any invariant relaxation requires explicit amendment in this ticket and the shared security model document.
Reviewer denial is expected for invariant-unmapped behavior changes.
